imgCaption: Liepaja, Latvia, 15-17.12.1941 - Women before they were executed.
Catholic clergy and Nazi officials, including Joseph Goebbels (far right) and Wilhelm Frick (second from right), give the Nazi salute. Germany, date uncertain.
Digging Anti-Tank Trenches Near Moscow - Dmitri Baltermants, Russian (born Warsaw, Poland), 1912 - 1990
The Soviet Jewish writer Ilya Ehrenburg in a meeting with partisans following the liberation of Vilnius (Vilna) in 1944.
[2015] A view of the National Museum of the History of the Great Patriotic War (of 1941-1945), on the day of Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon's visit to Kiev.
Stalingrad, Children fountain. 1942
Carting the Dead, Kerch, Crimea, January 1943; print 2003. Gelatin silver print.
In the bitter days of retreat, Dnepropetrovsk region, 1941
Grief. Mass execution site, Kerch, Crimea, January 2, 1942
Alexander Kots and the State Darwin Museum staff hide museum items. Moscow, 1941
Stacking the evacuated funds of the Historical Library. Moscow, July 1941

sourceUrl: Horoshavin, V.A. & Akimova, L.N. & Shutov, O.. (2015). Sanitary services in the perm region during the Great Patriotic war. Health Risk Analysis. 89-94. 10.21668/health.risk/2015.2.11.eng.
imgCaption: The students of the Vaganova Ballet Academy, Leningrad, evacuated to Molotov Urals, taking lessons in the village, where they were temporary accomodated.
Soviet soldiers change their clocks to Moscow time in the German town of Neumarkt, Silesia (now Środa Śląska, Poland).
photog: Dmitri Baltermants. Russian, 1912-1990. From the almanac 'Winners'

imgCaption: Romanian POWs from the Battle of Stalingrad, November - December 1942.
credit: `The Dmitri Baltermants Collection/CORBIS/Corbis via Getty Images

imgCaption: The last execution, Painting by Naomi Judkowski, The Oswiecim Death Camp, Poland, January 1945.

Ringworm is cured in the chimney, Painting by Naomi Judkowski, The Oswiecim Death Camp, Poland, January 1945. The text in Polish: 'Anyone who has an abscess or ringworm — to the chimney! Abcesses and ringworm were common due to unhealthy food & the lack of vitamins.'

The execution of three partisans in the USSR. The partisans are urrounded by German soldiers. The partisan in the center has a sign around his neck, reading: 'We are partisans who fired on German soldiers.'

Third belorussian front, world war 2, a group of young women, red army snipers who have 2,000 german kills between them, inspecting a small town in east prussia that has been taken by the soviet army, february 1945.
Anna Chobutnieva, a Soviet partisan, milking a cow milking seized from the Germans behind enemy lines so that wounded members of the group can have fresh milk, october 1943.
A group of Soviet partisans, washing themselves with snow including Materna Zozula (2nd from left), who was a machine gunner and fell in combat.
Dr. Babukhadia, a physician in the Popudrenko partisan unit, performing field surgery on a wounded partisan.In the photo: Lubimov (on the right; first name unknown), a Jewish nurse.
A group of Soviet partisans during a lull in the fighting.

Vasiliev, a radio operator in a Soviet partisan unit, letting a Soviet peasant listen to a broadcast of Radio Moscow. This was to quash a rumor circulating in the man's village, that Moscow had fallen into German hands.

Soviet poster praising the Fabrikant family, a family of Jewish fighters from Olgopol, Ukraine. Headline: Legendary People - Residents of the same city take part in the Great Patriotic War. The poster shows Michail Fabrikant (left), a fighter in the Zhdanov partisan battalion, Riva Fabrikant, a courier in this battalion, and Efim Fabrikant, Pod - Polkovnik (lieutenant colonel) in the ranks of the Red Army.
The editors' room of a Soviet partisan organ.In the photo: Baskin (on the left; first name unknown).
Soviet anti-Nazi poster. Russian Text: 'History cannot be turned back... Europe will not forget the glorious path of the fearless Soviet soldier, Liberator and brother!'
The hanging of the partisan Zoya Kosmodiemianskaia near Moscow, December 1941. On her neck is a sign describing the reason for her execution: she set fire to a building with German soldiers inside.
altText: The hanging of the partisan Zoya Kosmodiemianskaia near Moscow, in December 1941. On her neck is a sign describing the reason for her execution: she set fire to a building with German soldiers inside. Also in the photo: civilians and German soldiers. Note: her brother, Shura Kosmodiamienski, was posthumously decorated a 'Hero of the Soviet Union' for his service in a Red Army tank corps.

imgCaption: Deportation - a drawing by Marko Behar, a Jewish partisan from Bulgaria. See his entry on the partisans website of the Ghetto Fighters' House: www.partisans.co.il
altText: Deportation - a drawing by Marko Behar, a Jewish partisan from Bulgaria showing a line of Jewish people including children in a line next to a German officer during World War 2

imgCaption: Partisans Shooting from an Ambush, Linocut print by Alexander Bogen (1916-2010), a member of “United Partisans Organization” & the “Revenge” partisan battalion in Belarus/Lithuania
altText: A print by Jewish artist/partisan Alexander Bogen, displaying 3 partisans shooting a machine gun from an ambush

imgCaption: Partisans Sabotaging Railroad Tracks, Linocut print by Alexander Bogen (1916-2010), a member of “United Partisans Organization” & the “Revenge” partisan battalion in Belarus/Lithuania
altText: A linocut print by Jewish artist/partisan Alexander Bogen displaying 2 partisans sabotaging a railway track to Minsk used by German occupiers during World War 2

imgCaption: Escape from a Transport Train (1943), Pencil drawing by Richter Joseph, Polish text on the reverse side: 'A forest near the Sobibor camp. She escaped from a transport. The last railroad car has a machine gun. The forest isn't dense.
altText: Pencil drawing of a woman's body facedown next to a train track in a sparse forest on the way to the Death Camp Sobibor

imgCaption: Partisans, Oil Painting (made in 1990) by Alexander Bogen (1916-2010), a member of “United Partisans Organization” & the “Revenge” partisan battalion in Belarus/Lithuania
altText: An oil painting by Jewish artist/partisan Alexander Bogen displaying 5 partisans in white coveralls carrying weapons and the head of a horse on the bottom-left of the frame

imgCaption: Partisan (1943), Pen & ink drawing by Nino Franchina (1912-1987), an Italian artist
altText: A grotesque image of a slouched bald man with a wrinkled face carrying a weapon in red ink

imgCaption: Sentenced to Death, Woodcut print by artist/partisan Renzo Bussotti (Italian, 1925 - 2017)
altText: A partisan prisoner in shackles laying on the ground with open, sad eyes, a monstrous guard smiling creepily holding a weapon standing over the partisan.

imgCaption: Towards an Encounter with Partisans, Woodcut print by Italian artist Alberto Cavallari, From an album of 13 woodcuts about the Italian Underground and the years of German occupation in Italy, published in 1957
altText: Print displaying three Italian peasant women looking at different directions near a wheel cart waiting to meet partisans

imgCaption: Partisan Ambush Attack, Watercolor by Arnold Weinberg
altText: A barefoot partisan attacking a German soldier holding a rock over his head and blood splashing from the head of the soldier

imgCaption: Partisans Marching, Oil Painting (made in 1990) by Alexander Bogen (1916-2010), a member of “United Partisans Organization” & the “Revenge” partisan battalion in Belarus/Lithuania
altText: A line of partisans marching carrying weapons on their back past a tree with no leaves and a vast sky on a snow-filled ground

imgCaption: Partisan Carrying a Man, Watercolor and ink drawing by Moshe Kupferman (Poland, 1926-2003)
altText: A partisan carrying an injured man

imgCaption: A Hanged Partisan, Lithograph art by Giacomo Manzu (1908-1991)
altText: A patisan hanged upside down

imgCaption: A hanged partisan, woodcut print by Bartoli
altText: A hanged figure with a sign around his neck with text Partisan with fire in the background

imgCaption: An Execution, Woodcut print by Ernesto Treccani (Italian 1920-2009) an artist/partisan/anti-fascist
altText: A condemned partisan leaning against a wall and two executioner with weapons pointing at the partisan

imgCaption: Facing the Horror, Marker and watercolor by Achile Pace (art made during World War 2)
altText: A disturbed woman crying over a dead body with German soldiers in the background

imgCaption: Setting for a Children's Play at the Ghetto Theater in the Vilnius Ghetto, Gouache and ink by Unidentified Artists. The inscription reads: Setting for the play 'One Less Hanukkah Candle' (In Yiddish), performed by the children of the Yeladim boarding school of 4 Straszun Street on 6 December 1942 at the ghetto theater.
altText: Setting for a children's play displaying an urban area with cable car moving and apartments on both sides of the street

imgCaption: Prometheus, Linocut print by Julo Levin (German, 1901-1943), murdered in Holocaust
altText: Image of Prometheus and the eagle devouring his liver

imgCaption: Three Figures, Their Arms Clasped Above Their Heads (1944), Pen & Ink drawing by Carlo Ramo
altText: Three Figures, probably Jewish intmates during Holocaust with their arms clasped above their heads.

imgCaption: The Horror, Mixed technique by Haskiel Kujawski (1910-1969), artist and survivor of Lodz Ghetto and Mauthausen camp
altText: The painting displays a Jewiish family with the parents horrified and the young girl covering her eyes in shame while topless and a German officer with gun drawn behind the father.

imgCaption: Like Animals, mixed technique by Haskiel Kujawski (1910-1969), artist and survivor of Lodz Ghetto and Mauthausen camp
altText: A wild scene displaying German soldiers seperating Jewish families while attacking young Jewish women in different states of undressing to sexually assault and torture.

imgCaption: Hitler - portrait, Pen and Ink Drawing by Clement Moreau also known as Carl Meffert, (German 1903-1988).
altText: Cartoon of Hitler as a grotesque figure with mad eyes

imgCaption: German soldiers giving themselves up to Red Army soldiers near Moscow.
altText: Four German soldiers with their hands over their heads surrendering to four Soviet soldiers in white coveralls and carrying weapons.

imgCaption: A row of gallows on which Soviet hostages were hanged by the German army.
altText: A row of gallows on which Soviet hostages were hanged by the German army with plumes of smokes in the background.

imgCaption: A group of Soviet partisans, washing themselves with snow. Materna Zozula (2nd left) was a machine gunner who fell in combat.
altText: A group of six Soviet partisans washing themselves with snow.

imgCaption: Two Soviet partisans reading the newspaper, Krasnaya Zvezda [Russian: Red Star].
altText: Two Soviet partisans reading the Red Star newspaper with two horses in the background.

imgCaption: An official burial ceremony for Soviet civilians killed by the Germans in Rostov - na - Donu (Rostov - on - the - Don), USSR. The bodies were exhumed of a mass grave and placed in coffins for reburial. Red Army soldiers who took part in the city's liberation participated in the ceremony along with civilians.
altText: An official burial ceremony for Soviet civilians killed by the Germans in Rostov

imgCaption: Kombat. This image captures junior politruk Aleksei Yeryomenko, minutes before his death on 12 July 1942, in Voroshilovgrad Oblast (Luhansk Oblast), Ukraine.
altText: It depicts a Soviet military officer armed with a TT pistol who is raising his unit for an attack during World War II. This work is regarded as one of the most iconic Soviet World War II photographs.

imgCaption: Soviet collaborators beside a wagon loaded with the corpses of Jews after an 'Aktion' (roundup) in a settlement in Galicia (present day Poland/Ukrain). The soldiers are from Vlasov's army and it appears that they are looting the bodies.
altText: Several Nazi collaborators collecting starved bodies of Jewish prisoners into a cart and looting what they can.

imgCaption: Soviet partisans in a forest.
altText: Six partisans eating and chatting together while laying on the forest ground while in the background there are more partisans sitting.

imgCaption: Two children evacuated from Leningrad during the Siege are reunited with their mother. Soviet Information Bureau Photograph Collection, Davis Center Collection, Harvard Library
altText: Two young, happy girls with short hair in their mother's embrace.

imgCaption: A group of employees of the medical unit at the commander's car. The 142nd Medical Unit two kilometres east of the village of Shuli, 91st Infantry Division, 51st Army, 4th Ukrainian Front. 8 May 1944
altText: Eight employees of the medical unit at the commander's car. One is using crutches. Their vibe is joyous with smiles and holding flowers.

imgCaption: Guns of the 35th battery blown up by Soviet troops during the evacuation of Sevastopol in 1942. May 1
altText: Heavy artillery of Soviet army blown up and surrounded by Red Army soldiers on their retreat in the early years of the War in 1942.

imgCaption: What goes around in 1941, comes around in 1945. A suburb of Berlin, Germany. May 1945.
altText: Injured German civilians in distress ecavuating their belongings and pulling an injured young man in a baby's trolly to a safer place.

imgCaption: Horses shot by the Germans in the area of the 35th battery during the retreat, Ukrain, USSR. May 1944
altText: Carcasses of many murdered horses laying in disarray on the ground with a human in the far end of the picture.

imgCaption: Lama Sabachthani? [Why have you forsaken me?] (1943), oil on canvas, Morris Kestelman (British, 1905-1998)
altText: A scene of mourning. A group of Jewish men, women and children weep and mourn over a mound of corpses. In the background are further large heaps of corpses and burning buildings. The mourning men wear prayer shawls and pillbox hats and carry Torah scrolls; the women wear headscarves or shawls over their hair.

imgCaption: A mass grave at the Bergen-Belsen camp (1945)-Oil on canvas by Leslie Cole (British, 1910-1976)
altText: View from one end of a huge mass grave containing the emaciated remains of Belsen inmates. SS guards, guarded by British soldiers, are throwing more bodies into the pit. Part of the Belsen compound can be seen in the background.

imgCaption: Death March (Czechowice-Bielsko, January 1945), gouache on paper by Jan Hartman (Czechoslovakia, Holocaust Survivor b.1926).
altText: A line of concentration camp prisoners being marched through a winter landscape. They are accompanied by guards and walk past bodies lying in the foreground.

imgCaption: Through all these grim days cultural life continued in the front line city Leningrad. In December the Leningrad City Theatre gave the premiere of the ballet La Esmeralda, a ballet inspired by Victor Hugo's Notre-Dame de Paris, which was performed thirty-one times from December 1942 until the end of the war. Stamped American Russian Cultural Association, NYC
altText: A poster for La Esmerlda play by the Leningrad City Theatre in 1942 during the Leningrad siege, The Great Patriotic War.

imgCaption: The city has carefully covered and camouflaged the statue of Lenin. Stamped American Russian Cultural Association, NYC
Militiamen near Moscow. Cyclists squad (1941)
altText: A line of Soviet militia men next to their bicycles during the day in 1941

imgCaption: Digging anti-tank ditches near Moscow (Sept-Oct 1941)
Girls camouflage the Yak-1 fighter aircraft (June 22, 1941-September 30, 1941)
Soldiers inspect captured artillery pieces (1941-1943)
Untitled, Leningrad (June 22, 1941 - December 31, 1941)
Artillery shellingm (1941 - 1943), Leningrad region
altText: Katyusha shooting

imgCaption: Muscovites at the construction of defensive structures
altText: A group of civilians mostly women digging defensive fortifications (ditches) wearing scarfes and winter coats

imgCaption: Deer Yasha (1941-42), Murmansk, Arctic Circle
altText: A deer that wandered into the city of Murmansk during the war and Hawker Hurricane Aircrafts in the sky

imgCaption: Sverdlov Square (1941), A downed fascist bomber, Moscow
Military road (1941)
altText: A dead body laying on a snow-filled road with a horse cart in the background in 1941, USSR

imgCaption: Over the corpses of relatives. Moscow region, Maloyaroslavets (September - November 1941) source: Izvestia Newspaper
Nina Deeva, Marina Nikolskaya and Liza Bystrova in special hoods during a practical lesson on extinguishing incendiary bombs (June 22, 1941 - December 31, 1941), Moscow.
Prisoners of war (September 1941) Source: MAMM/MDF

Victim of fascist terror ( First public execution in Minks, Oct-26-1941). The hanged woman is Olga Shcherbatsevich, a cultural worker at the 3rd Minsk City Hospital, the founder of a group to rescue the wounded from the hospital where she worked. They were not partisans. Occupied Minsk, Belarus
Squat down! (1941 - 1942) Source: MAMM / MDF
altText: A gorup of Red Army soldiers dancing to guitar/harmonic music in a forest setting with caps and smiles

imgCaption: Organization of the ghetto (July 20, 1941 - August 31, 1941) in Minsk, Belarus
Remains of Red Army prisoners of war in Stalag 352 (1941 - 1942), Minsk, Byelorussian SSR
altText: A mass grave of Red Army POWs, Minsk, Belarus

imgCaption: Market in occupied Minsk (1941 - 1942)
altText: Horse sleigh in a snow-filled market with a young boy in the foreground looking int he camera and elder men in the background

imgCaption: Liberation of Kaluga, 150 km southwest of Moscow. (December 1, 1941 - February 28, 1942) Bloody trail of fascist bandits. The advancing units of the Red Army found the bodies of brutally tortured comrades who had ended up in German captivity along the entire front.
